docs.lead_paragraph: 9 P.M. (13, 49) TEST TUBE BABIES -- They called her ''the baby of the century,'' and as the result of the world's first successful in vitro fertilization, Louise Brown became a symbol of the technological revolution in human reproduction. This''American Experience'' looks at the decade-long collaboration between Landrum Shettles, a New York gynecologist, and Robert Edwards, an English physiologist, that resulted in the pregnancy of Lesley Brown (above) and the birth of her daughter, Louise, on July 25, 1978. 8 P.M. (FOX) PRISON BREAK -- There's a traitor in our midst. Sucre turns on the rest of the gang and escapes with the $5 million, andLincoln decides to reunite with his son, L. J., though he may be walking into a trap. And how did Tweener die, anyway? Internal affairswants to know. 9 P.M. (CBS) TWO AND A HALF MEN -- Love is blind. Tonight, Charlie can't see that he's dating a younger version of his mother. 9 P.M. (Fox) JUSTICE -- The firm defends a teenage outcast who killed the school bully by murder most foul. 9 P.M. (Sundance) LANGUAGE DOES NOT LIE -- During World War II, Victor Klemperer (right), a German of Jewish heritage, chronicled the Nazi regime's use of language as a means of thought control. This documentary considers Klemperer's observation. 9 P.M. (History) GREECE: AGE OF ALEXANDER -- Peter Weller is host of this ''Engineering an Empire'' special, which looks at the architectural marvels that enabled the Greek Empire to become the world's first superpower. 9 P.M. (National Geographic) THE DOG WHISPERER -- This week's finalists in the unacceptable behavior category: an Australian shepherd who bites and lunges since losing an eye; a hound from an animal testing lab who's afraid of people; and a Maltese who doesn't wait to go outside before relieving itself. 9 P.M. (Travel) BOB GELDOF IN AFRICA -- He first visited Africa in 1984; the result was Live Aid, which inspired millions of dollars in donations to its undernourished people. In this special, Sir Bob navigates the culture, history, climate and politics of the continent more than 20 years later. 10 P.M. (NBC) STUDIO 60 ON THE SUNSET STRIP -- Jordan parties with the underlings after the show. Meanwhile, Matt just can't get Harriet out of his mind. 10 P.M. (Logo) JACOB AND JOSHUA: NEMESIS RISING -- Tonight on this reality series about gay rock musicians, the Miller brothers (Joshua, above left, and Jacob) come out to their parents. KATHRYN SHATTUCK

docs.lead_paragraph: Charles Siebert’s article (Oct. 8) was hopeful,sad and enlightening. The parallels between people and elephantsjogged my mind. The description of the elephant hanging was gut-wrenching. A racist lynching? An argument against capital punishment? Thank you for telling the story from the elephants’ point of view. Theperspective gained helps us to understand not only the elephants but also ourselves.

docs.lead_paragraph: IF I ask my 16-year-old twin sons to do something with me, like go to a movie or take a bike ride, they think it's hilarious. ''Yeah, right, Dad,'' says Sam.

docs.lead_paragraph: Elizabeth Weil's article (Sept 24) presented important information but did not address the issue of prevention in the most common cause of genital ambiguity, congenital adrenal hyperplasia, in which the adrenal glands overproduce androgens (malelike hormones), owing to a genetic defect. These overproduced androgens masculinize the female fetus in utero, such that she is born with ambiguous genitalia, making sex assignment in the newborn difficult. There is now ample evidence that treatment of the fetus by administering medication to the mother from early in pregnancy to term can prevent the masculinization of the genitalia in the female fetus. Prenatal diagnosis (via DNA analysis) and treatment have proven so far to be effective. Such treatment prevents genital ambiguity and causes the affected female to be born with normal female genitalia, and thus no confusion of sex assignment. Maria New, M.D. Director, Adrenal Steroid Disorders Program, Mount Sinai School of Medicine New York
